attributes.action: ask the Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport to request the Premier League withdraw the automatic 9 point penalty for clubs that enter administration.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The 9 point penalty currently automatically imposed on football clubs who enter financial administration is both unjust and ineffective.

It only serves to penalise fans, supporters and players who have had no role in the financial structure or running of the club and are therefore not at fault.

Additionally, the guilty parties who financially ruined the club may have subsequently left and therefore are unaffected by the punishment.

This is an ineffective penalty, which unjustly punishes innocent fans and supporters who are the heart of any football club.

It should be scrapped with immediate effect and an alternative, appropriate penalty should be considered.

rejection.details: The FA is independent of government. This a matter for direct communication with the FA.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
